meanings.definition: Having the characteristics of a trap.
meanings.sent1: The trappy door closed suddenly, surprising the mouse.
meanings.sent2: The hunter set up a trappy snare to catch wild animals.
meanings.sent3: The trappy box looked harmless but contained a hidden mechanism.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was trappy, luring him into a false sense of security.
meanings.sent5: The trappy forest path led travelers into a dangerous area.

meanings.sent1: The trappy advertisement promised quick riches with no effort.
meanings.sent2: She gave him a trappy excuse for being late to the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The trappy magician made the audience believe he could fly.
meanings.sent4: His trappy smile hid his true intentions from everyone.
meanings.sent5: The trappy appearance of the product masked its poor quality.
